com.thekeirs.games.engine

Class BackgroundImageScene

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.thekeirs.games.engine.Scene
      • com.thekeirs.games.engine.BackgroundImageScene

  • public class BackgroundImageScene
extends Scene

    A scene consisting of a single fixed background image

    If you want your game to have a background more interesting than a SolidColorScene, create a new instance of this class with your desired image and pass that to the GameObjectManager.setScene(Scene) method.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BackgroundImageScene(GameObjectManager manager, int id)
      Create a new BackgroundImageScene with the given image.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BackgroundImageScene

        public BackgroundImageScene(GameObjectManager manager,
                            int id)
        Create a new BackgroundImageScene with the given image.
        Parameters:
        manager - pointer to the current game object manager
        id - resource ID of the image (eg R.raw.background_level1)

    • Method Detail

      • setImage

        public void setImage(int id)
        Change the image associated with this scene.

        This can be used sparingly (for example, if you want the "lights" to turn off on a scene so it gets darker at some point) but probably isn't high-preformance enough to use it to make an animated background (ie, don't call setImage every single game update() loop!

        Parameters:
        id - resource ID of the image (eg R.raw.background_level2)

      • draw

        public void draw(android.graphics.Canvas c)
        Used by the game engine to draw the image on the screen. Do not call this directly.
        Specified by:
        draw in class Scene
        Parameters:
        c - the canvas object for the current screen
